title: Python and Indesign
content:
Hello everyone,

does anyone know if it is possible to use Python to control Adobe applications, particularly InDesign? I make lots of catalogues based on excel sheets, and I want to automate the formatting and image placement. Would Python be the best thing for the job? Apparently these guys do it, but to what extent and for what purpose I can’t fathom. [http://www.pragma2000.com/index\_eng.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200531/http:/www.pragma2000.com/index_eng.shtml "http://www.pragma2000.com/index\_eng.shtml") Any thoughts would be welcome.

comments.content:
If I am not mistaken there are a lot of things you can do in InDesign with Javascript.

You can download some reference here:  
 [http://www.adobe.com/products/indesign/scripting.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200531/http:/www.adobe.com/products/indesign/scripting.html "http://www.adobe.com/products/indesign/scripting.html")

Unless there is a particular reason why you want to use Python.
